module.name: LCLPlatformDef
module.short: Contains routines and types used in LCL Platform definitions.

descr.p: lclplatformdef.pas contains types, constants, variables and routines used in LCL platform definitions.
This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: TLCLPlatform
element.short: Represents the supported platforms for the LCL.

element.name: TLCLPlatform.lpMUI
element.short: Magic User Interface (MUI) for AmigaOS, AROS.

element.name: TLCLPlatforms
element.short: Set type used to store TLCLPlatform enumeration value(s).

element.name: DirNameToLCLPlatform
element.short: Gets the platform enumeration value for the specified directory name.

descr.p: DirNameToLCLPlatform is a TLCLPlatform function used to get the platform identifier for the source directory specified in the ADirName argument. It is assumed that ADirName contains only the directory name relative to ($LazarusDir)/lcl/interfaces without path delimiters. In other words, a value like: 'win32', 'qt5', or 'gtk3'.

DirNameToLCLPlatform performs a case-insensitive comparison between ADirName and each of the values in the LCLPlatformDirNames constant. The return value is the enumeration value which identifies the platform and widgetset for the specified directory.
If a matching value in LCLPlatformDirNames is not found, the return value is set to lpGtk2.
DirNameToLCLPlatform is called from the lazbuild utility when a widgetset override has been provided on the command line.

element.name: DirNameToLCLPlatform.Result
element.short: TLCLPlatform enumeration value for the given directory name.

element.name: DirNameToLCLPlatform.ADirName
element.short: Directory name to convert to a TLCLPlatform enumeration value.

element.name: LCLPlatformDirNames
element.short: Array constant with the directory names for supported LCL platforms.

descr.p: LCLPlatformDirNames is a array of Strings with directory names for the platforms supported for the LCL. The directory names are relative to the ($LazarusDir)/lcl/interfaces base path and should not include path delimiters. Values in the array are indexed by TLCLPlatform enumeration values.
Use LCLPlatformDisplayNames to get the display name for a given TLCLPlatform enumeration value.

element.name: BuildLCLWidgetType
element.short: Gets the TLCLPlatform enumeration value for the current platform.

descr.p: BuildLCLWidgetType is a TLCLPlatform variable with an enumeration value which identifies the widgetset for the current platform. Its value is determined by the compiler define active when the LCL was built. For example:

dl.dd: Sets the variable to lpCarbon for systems using the PowerPC processor. Otherwise, the variable is set to lpCocoa.

descr.p: For other platforms where a specific compiler define was not set, the variable is set to lpGtk2.
The value in BuildLCLWidgetType is used in the lazbuild utility to get the target widgetset used for the various platform defines, and when GetDefaultLCLWidgetType is called from the LCL interface.

element.version: For LCL version 2.2 and higher, the default widgetset for the macOS (Darwin) platform uses the Cocoa (lpCocoa) API. For versions prior to 2.2, the default widgetset used was the Carbon (lpCarbon) API. For Macs using the PowerPC processor, the widgetset continues to use the Carbon (lpCarbon) API.
